meanings.definition: Showing a casual lack of concern; indifferent
meanings.sent1: She had an insouciant attitude towards her upcoming exam.
meanings.sent2: He strolled through the park with an insouciant air.
meanings.sent3: The insouciant cat sauntered past the barking dog.
meanings.sent4: Her insouciant demeanor in the face of danger was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The insouciant teenager shrugged off the criticism with ease.

meanings.sent1: The insouciant child skipped along the beach without a care in the world.
meanings.sent2: She greeted each challenge with an insouciant smile.
meanings.sent3: His insouciant whistling echoed through the empty halls.
meanings.sent4: The insouciant breeze rustled the leaves gently.
meanings.sent5: The insouciant laughter of the friends filled the room with joy.
